text:
Some of the core and optional ant tasks, specifically but not limited to <sql> 
and <mail>, could use jndi to specify connections and mailhosts respectively.

Integrated ant jndi support could be useful in junit tests also.
creator: thierry.lach@bbdodetroit.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
I'd propose teasing it out into a <jndiget> task that sets a property with some
jndi string, and a jndiset to go the other way.

creator: thierry.lach@bbdodetroit.com
text:
The primary need internal to ant IMO would be to have ant provide any and all 
contexts for jndi requests, both in forked and non-forked tasks.

The initial need I was trying to fill with this suggestion was to be able to 
write junit tests for classes usable in (but not restricted to) servlets, that 
would be getting a database connection from jndi.
